title: Fission Cross-Section Of Pu-239 At 13.1 To 15.4 Mev

freetext: The ratio of the quantities of Pu-239 to those of
U-238 in the targets was obtained by measuring the
alpha-activity by semiconductor detector.The overall
error in the measurement of the quantity of Pu-239 was
2 per cent, U-238 3 per cent.
pieces of mica were used to detect fission
fragments.

neutrons were obtained from the T(d,n)He-4 reac-
tion by bombarding with deuterons accelerated to an
energy of 440 keV in Van-de-Graaff accelerator.
,a thin titanium target (0.280 mg/cm2) in which
tritium gas was absorbed.
Counter ratio of U-238 and Pu-239 samples was
used.Plutonium samples were placed simultaneously at
various angles of neutron emission. Plutonium samples
along with the uranium samples were placed in shields
made from cadmium foil of a thickness of 0.5 mm.
Plutonium sigma fission  was  measured
relatively to that of U-238 and normalized to sigma
fission of U-238 from K.Parker,AWRE-0-79/1963.
